data.title: Sadly disappointed
data.text: Had been wanting to go there since it opened. Took my mother for brunch. Too much to write but will go there again in hopes just was an off day.  Waiter was very odd. Food was not very good taste wise- but again maybe an off day in the kitchen and there was only one other table of two people at 1 pm on a Sunday for brunch....

data.title: A nice place
data.text: Came here for a business meeting. A great selection of seafood and steaks, appetizers and desserts. They have a wide variety of oysters which we definitely partook of and all ordered the sirloin which came with a choice of sauces. While the streak was ok, it was a little chewy and bland compared to the nice presentation and price. We all agreed that the oysters were a lot better than the main meal. So maybe it was an off night for the food and we would try it again based on the atmosphere and nice menu selections.

data.title: The best thing about Kimpton Cardinal Hotel
data.text: Came for breakfast at 7am (4am where I live). Exhausted from the prior 3 weeks and frustration with hotel staff since arrival, it was nice to meet the hostess who had a very genuine warm personality. I even liked the gruff waitress, because it felt honest.  We were the 2nd group that arrived.  It took awhile to get biscuits and gravy and an order of biscuit with fruit. The biscuits were light and gravy was tasty but not lead.  Coffee was strong (yes!) but latte tasted like soap.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, General Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello,

I wanted to reach out and thank you for dining with us. I also want you to know that I value your feedback and will share this with the entire team. We welcome the opportunity to get better, and hope to have the opportunity to get it right next time you dine with us. Please feel free to reach out at anytime.

Regards,
Herbie Gimmel
GM
herbie.gimmel@katharinebrasserie.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Drinks and snacks really good
data.text: Stopped in for a few cocktails and snacks before a wine tasting. Excellent drinks on the menu - the Winston something or other  (name?) is like a cross between a negroni and a manhattan and is superb. Shrimp and oysters from the raw bar were very high quality, and the cocktail sauce superb. Second time there, haven't had a chance to do a full dinner yet but it is on the list! Beautiful setting in the rehabbed Reynolds building and great service too.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Wanted to reach out and thank you for stopping by! Looking forward for your return!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Very good "special occasion" place to dine!
data.text:
Based on the review of this restaurant in the "Good Eats" section of Garden and Gun magazine / Nov.2016, we selected this place to celebrate our 48th wedding anniversary.

The restaurant greeted us with a complimentary champagne toast, which we truly appreciated.

We started the meal with a shared bowl of Vidalia Onion Soup and a Caesar Salad. Both were excellent!

After ordering an outstanding bottle of Staghorn cabernet, I had the 8 oz. Bistro Filet with Bourbon Peppercorn Sauce and garlic mashed potatoes ($21). My husband ordered the 10 oz. Filet Mignon with Béarnaise Sauce and olive oil crushed potatoes ($40). We also shared a plate of Grilled Asparagus with Béarnaise​. My 8 oz. filet steak was a bit chewier than my husband's 10 oz. filet... but both had outstanding flavor. 

A few disappointments ... both the Bourbon Peppercorn and Béarnaise​sauce were beyond lackluster. In fact, our versions at home are far tastier. His olive oil crushed potatoes had little flavor. I should send my husband's recipe for "garlic smashed potatoes" to the chef.

But all of that aside, the Katherine is a GORGEOUS restaurant and we had a wonderful anniversary evening. Winston Salem is lucky to have such an elegant restaurant to brag about!!

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, General Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I wanted to reach out and thank you for spending your anniversary here with us! We appreciate your feedback and will share it with the team. Hope to have you back soon.

Regards,
Herbie
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Drinks at the Katharine
data.text: I had to come here because of the namesake. I learned that The Katharine Brassierie is named after Katharine Smith Reynolds and she and her husband, the tobacco tycoon RJ Reynolds, loved going to Paris. This restaurant and bar are modeled after their trips to the city of love. I only had drinks in the bar and it was a very lively atmosphere on a Saturday night. The Katharine is located inside the Kimpton Cardinal Hotel and was very popular among the hotel guests and also locals. Jillian was our bartender and she mixed up some great cocktails and told us each ingredient as she was putting the masterpieces together. My favorite drinks was the War of the Roses. The Empire State Smash was also very tasty. You can order from the restaurant menu and some people were enjoying cocktails and dessert. The service was great and we really enjoyed our evening. I cannot speak to the food yet the drinks were delicious and I would come here after an evening out on the town or while staying in the hotel. The bar has an upscale feel and it is the perfect place to get dressed up and enjoying a fancier drink.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We wanted to reach out and thank you for coming to our bar! We will share your kind words with the entire team! Hope to have you in for dinner soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Worth Trying Again and Again
data.text:
Took our staff of 5 here for our company owner's birthday.  If you're going early on a Friday evening as we were, give yourself a bit of extra drive time as traffic on the perimeter highways can be slow.  Once there, however, they offer complimentary valet service for dinner guests, plus there are a couple of city parking decks very close by if you prefer to self-park.  The restaurant's menu has French overtones, the ambiance is a mix of modern and Art Deco, to compliment the gorgeous building, and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.

Each of us tried a different entree—mussels, chicken, beef filet, corvina and grouper—and no one left a scrap on their plate.  I also had the arugula and fig salad which was quite yummy.

It's definitely a place i'll go back to try other menu items.  A very fun, relaxed but also fine evening.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We wanted to reach out and thank you for dining with us! Hope to have you back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Went back a second time
data.text: I went back to Katharine's a second time, and it was a wonderful experience.  The hostess was friendly, the waitress was delightful and helpful and the food was truly delicious.  I will definitely go back and would recommend it to others.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, General Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm so pleased to hear this! Thank you for giving us another try!!! 

Regards,
Herbie
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: An Adventure in French/Southern Taste
data.text: Excellent and casual dining. Ate 'Le Poulet Rouge', rich flavor roasted chicken. The staff was enthusiastic, well trained locals.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your kind words! Hope to have you back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: At last a Kimpton in Winston Salem !
data.text: Here for a very wet Wake Parents Weekend. Ate breakfast in the restaurant it was excellent. Bar area was very nice & we were a party of 12,put a few bar tables together & had a server that was incredible.Bar food can really be improved, I had a sad looking expensive shrimp cocktail. Tried to watch some of the Wake game on the 2 TV's, but they were so very small you could hardly see. New, bigger tv's please, or what's the point.Large table at end of bar was empty & reserved for hrs.,get rid of it during weekends like this & put some more bar tables & stools in. Heard dinner at the restaurant was good,small portions & yes expensive. Love Kimpton & I'm hoping they learn from that weekend.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, General Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you for your feedback! This will be shared with the entire team. Hope to have you back soon.

Regards,
Herbie
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Contemporary and upscale
data.text: This is a newer location in downtown Winston-Salem for a cocktail or glass of wine. It is noisy however.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for trying us out! Hope to have you back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great bar and restaurant in the Cardinal Hotel
data.text: Set in the gorgeous art deco style Cardinal Hotel in downtown Winston-Salem near Innovation Quarter, this is the new hot spot in town.  The bar is gorgeous and has a great vibe.  There is a ton of outdoor space as well. We had some really good apps at the bar as well.  The only ate breakfast at the restaurant so I can't speak to lunch or dinner.  The selections were excellent for breakfast and the service was excellent.  The food was very good and fresh.  Certainly the best hotel restaurant in the area.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your feedback! Hope to have you in for dinner soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Beautiful building, great food, service & atmosphere
data.text: We picked the restaurant because it was new, and because of the fact that it's in the historic Reynolds building, newly renovated, and we wanted to see it. We thoroughly enjoyed our food-oysters and scallops as appetizers, plat du jour (veal) and grouper, and dessert (pot de creme). We thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance (and that of the entire building as well) and our service was very competent, including several times that we were approached by the manager. He was a delight to talk to and solved our only complaint - that we had received skim milk instead of cream for the coffee. He simply brought us a pitcher of cream! Yes, it was expensive. Yes, the dining room is configured so that it's difficult to hear. Don't know what could be done about that however. Yes, it was worth it!

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi there,

We wanted to reach out and thank you for dining with us! We hope to have you back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: lovely setting
data.text: The inside of the restaurant (and the outdoor patio) are beautiful. Whoever designed the space did an excellent job; unfortunately, the food itself was not quite as excellent. We started out the jonah crab claw. Granted, we've never had one of these so we weren't quite sure what to expect, but the meat was tough and small. The mustard sauce on the side was tasty, though, but I'm not sure I would have paired it with the crab. We each had the bistro filet as our main, the meat itself was cooked perfectly, but the sauces were too salty (I did the red wine reduction, he had the peppercorn). Wine list was decent, but not extensive (we had the Bordeaux and were pleased). Overall, service was great, ambiance was fantastic, but the food was just fine. We'd definitely go back for drinks at the bar, but I think we might give it a little time before checking out the food again.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We wanted to reach out and thank you for your feedback regarding food, service, and atmosphere. This will be shared with the entire team. Hope to have you back soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Could not get  beyond the rude waitress
data.text:
My wife and I like to eat out for lunch a lot.   We were excited to see that we had a new French alternative to try.  We were a bit put off by the cost of the on line version of the menu, but decided we'd give it a try.

We'd love to give the food a good review, but we did not get that far.   The waitress was so rude, we had two interactions in five minutes and walked out without giving it a fair try.   

Our first interaction went something like...   "Do you want something besides water to drink, while I had the wine list in my hands."

A few minutes later the server showed back up and the interaction went something like........  "Are you ready to order,  what do you want?"  A bit of courtesy goes a long way.  Where are the supervisors for people who need much more training in the service industry.  We are an average couple with reasonable expectations ...We can choose where to have our $150 lunch.

The prices are astronomical and the menu offering is extremely limited -. The cheapest wine on the menu was $50.

We walked out - Never again!!!

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, General Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi there,

I wanted to personally reach out and apologize for any rude behavior from my team. I appreciate your feedback and will share this with my team. We are striving to get better daily and hope you give us another try. 

Please reach out to me directly if you decide to return. We would welcome the opportunity to get this right.

Regards,
Herbie Gimmel
GM
herbie.gimmel@katharinebrasserie.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Convenient
data.text: We stayed at the hotel, so this was convenient. I felt satisfied with my  choice, hamburger, but my husband's  chicken was a tiny scrawny portion for the price. Ate breakfast there as well...the omlette didn't even come with a piece of bread. I would eat there again, for the convenience, but not drive across town for it.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We wanted to reach out and thank you for your comments. We will share this with the team. Hope you give us another try soon!

data.title: Really good, but not yet great.
data.text: The food was really good, not great. The menu had some interesting items but nothing that I got really excited about. This time I had the duck, which was again good, not great. The service is pretty good and you can see the kitchen, which is nice. The best thing there are the oysters which are clearly selected based on what's great that week and the escargot with hush puppies--a fun combination that really works.

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review

data.title: Expected more
data.text: I was greeted promptly and courteously by the host. The waitress was pleasant and tended to our needs. The restaurant was described as being "French cuisine with a southern flair." The filet mignon was a bit overcooked and small. The drinks from the bar seemed to be watered down and the cocktails weren't anything special. The desserts aren't made in house (beignets and pecan pie at least). Everything is overpriced.

data.title: Two Lovely Meals...
data.text:
Had dinner and breakfast here in conjunction with a one night stay at the Kimpton Cardinal.
Dinner: Our reservation was at 6 pm on a Friday Night and we were seated promptly. The decor is very modern/industrial and this contributes to a higher noise level, but the table spacing corrects this nicely. Our lovely server was at the ready with information and advice about the menu. Our vegetarian was made happy with lovely cast iron servers of fresh local produce. The piscetarian enjoyed a beautifully presented (HUGE) flounder meuniere . I chowed down on the Bistro filet, medium rare and tender. The Cookie Sampler and perfect coffee was a (well, almost) guilt free dessert for all three of us.
Breakfast:
Next morning we were thrilled to find that the perfection of the coffee the night before had NOT been our imagination. Fortified with this ever-flowing elixer of life, we experienced sweet potato pancakes (forget your diet, this is a delectable SIN), and possibly the best gruyere herb omelets forged by the hand of man.

Is this place cheap? No
Is it worth the money? Oh, YEAH!

owner_response.author: KatharineBB, General Manager at Katharine Brasserie and Bar, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for dining with us! We hope to have you back soon!!!

Regards,
Herbie
owner_response.title: Owner Response
